keyword: calories in a filet mignon 6 ounce
title: Calories in a 6 Ounce Filet Mignon
meta_description: Learn calories in a filet mignon 6 ounce, with protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition per serving, and easy tweaks for different preparations.
h1: Calories in a 6 Ounce Filet Mignon
assumptions: Beef tenderloin steak, lean only trimmed to 1/8 inch fat, choice grade, broiled, no added oil, salt, or sauce.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cut, grade, cooking method, added fats, and exact weight. Check labels or use a food scale for precision.

quick_answer.text: A 6-ounce broiled filet mignon provides 461 calories, 45.4 g protein, and 31.3 g fat.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Pan-seared with 1 tsp olive oil per 100 g
Extra lean, all visible fat removed per 100 g
Topped with 1 tbsp herb butter (adds ~100 kcal total)

faqs.q: How many calories in a filet mignon 6 ounce?
faqs.a: Approximately 461 calories for a broiled, lean 6-ounce filet mignon.

faqs.q: How much protein in 6 oz filet mignon?
faqs.a: About 45.4 g of protein per 6-ounce serving.
No carbohydrates, fiber, or sugars—it's a zero-carb protein source.

faqs.q: Is 6 oz filet mignon high in fat?
faqs.a: It has 31.3 g total fat, including 13.1 g saturated, due to natural marbling.

faqs.q: How does cooking method affect calories in filet mignon?
faqs.a: Broiling keeps it lean; frying or adding butter can add 40–100+ calories per serving.
